units.title: Seed AF cells in Matrigel for organoid formation
units.text: To investigate formation of AFOs we seeded viable AF cells in Matrigel droplets and cultured them in an ad hoc-defined generic epithelial medium without tissue-specific signals (Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: This is an actionable step describing the initial culture protocol for generating fetal epithelial organoids.

units.title: Pick and replating individual AFOs for clonal lines
units.text: Individual AFOs were picked, dissociated into single cells and replated (Fig. 2a,b and Extended Data Fig. 2a).
units.rationale: This describes a repeatable procedure to establish clonal organoid lines from primary organoids.

units.title: Confirm clonal origin via single-cell AFEpC culture
units.text: The clonal origin of AFOs was further confirmed by single-cell AFEpC culture (Extended Data Fig. 2b).
units.rationale: This is a validation step in the protocol to ensure clonality of derived organoids.

units.title: Perform immunostaining for epithelial and proliferation markers
units.text: Immunostaining confirmed cell proliferation (Ki67) and lack of apoptosis (cleaved caspase 3) within AFOs (Fig. 2f). We confirmed the AFO’s epithelial identity by staining for pan-epithelial markers (EpCAM, E-CAD and pan-cytokeratin) and showing absence of the mesenchymal marker platelet-derived growth factor receptor α (PDGFRα).
units.rationale: This outlines specific staining procedures to validate epithelial identity and viability of organoids.

units.title: Assess epithelial polarization via marker staining
units.text: Notably, AFO’s epithelium is polarized as demonstrated by basolateral integrin β4 (ITGβ4), apical F-actin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1)-positive tight junctions (Fig. 2g).
units.rationale: This is a protocol step to confirm functional epithelial polarization in organoids.

units.title: Perform bulk RNA-seq on AFO lines to determine tissue identity
units.text: We then conducted bulk RNA sequencing to investigate the tissue identity of each clonal AFO line.
units.rationale: This is a key analytical protocol step to assign tissue origin to organoid lines.

units.title: Perform intestinal ring formation assay for tissue engineering
units.text: Finally, to investigate the potential of SiAFOs for tissue engineering, we performed an intestinal ring formation assay (Fig. 3i).
units.rationale: This describes a functional assay to test tissue engineering capacity of intestinal organoids.

units.title: Culture KAFOs and assess renal gene expression
units.text: Kidney tubule AFOs (KAFOs) expanded long-term (up to passage 10), while maintaining proliferation (Ki67; Fig. 4a and Extended Data Fig. 4a) and mostly manifested a compact morphology with several lines showing a cystic structure. Bulk RNA-seq of 54 KAFOs (19 AF samples; 18–34 weeks GA) showed expression of canonical developmental renal epithelial and nephron progenitor genes (PAX2, PAX8, LHX1 and JAG1), while lacking cap mesenchyme markers (SIX2, CITED1 and GDNF).
units.rationale: This outlines a culture and molecular characterization protocol for kidney-derived organoids.
